questions.question: What is revealed about G & L?  'I got you to look after me, and you got me to look after you'

choices.answer: They are both incapable of surviving on their own
Contextually, their relationship is unique
They both long to look after other people
They are scared of not having each other

questions.question: Why does Crooks 'scowl' and speak 'sharply' to Lennie in Chapter 4?

choices.answer: Crooks doesn't like simpletons
Lennie is racist
He is suspicious of the way white people may treat him
Crooks is a really unfriendly person

questions.question: Significance of description? 'The bunkhouse was a long, rectangular building'

choices.answer: Makes it historically valid in terms of details
Shows the men sleep on bunks
Means the men have plenty of room
Reflects the lives of the ranch hands - dull and boring

questions.question: Significance? - 'Keep your place, Nigger. I could get you strung up on a tree so easy'

choices.answer: Demonstrates that Crooks is behaving badly
Reflects the harsh conditions of the Great Depression
Changes our perception of CW - she is a racist bully
Crooks often loses his sense of place

questions.question: Significance - 'Now what the hell ya suppose is eatin' them two guys?'

choices.answer: George and Slim are being eaten by something
Carlson (and therefore all ranch hands) lacks empathy
Demonstrates that Slim and George are now friends
Carlson wants to understnad the situation more fully

questions.question: Identify the real theme of OMAM

choices.answer: Animals
Relationships
Farm Work
Marriage
Pitiful
Headstrong
Pathetic
Contradictory

questions.question: Why does the novel end where it starts geographically?

choices.answer: The brush is isolated so George can kill Lennie on his own
Gives the text a nice sense of symmetry
Stresses the repetitive nature of life
Mirrors the hardship of the 1930s

questions.question: Which of the following foreshadows the death of Lennie most obviously?

choices.answer: Candy's dog
Dead puppy
Dead mouse
Dead watersnake

questions.question: Which of these is not a dream in the novel?

choices.answer: Be in the movies (fame, wealth etc)
Own property (Independence)
Manage other people (control, power etc)
Make investments (security, safety)
